entry.title: Ecash TIDES using Cashu and Stratum v2
entry.summary: Cryptographic attestation involves a method where the pool or mint authenticates individual shares through digital signatures. These signatures play a crucial role in the verification process, ensuring that once a share is validated and signed, its integrity is preserved. This mechanism serves as a protective measure against unauthorized modifications, highlighting any alterations post-validation as potential security breaches. By implementing cryptographic attestation, hash providers gain a reliable means to identify and safeguard against malicious activities, ensuring that the data integrity remains uncompromised from the moment of share validation onwards. This process not only enhances the security framework around share distribution but also instills a layer of trust and reliability within the system, as stakeholders can be confident in the authenticity and unaltered state of each share validated by the pool or mint.
